intro: Bigelowia douglasii var. tortifolia, commonly known as the Douglas's bigelowia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its foliage has a distinctive waxy texture and a mild, aromatic scent. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, attract a variety of pollinators including bees and butterflies.
